page.title: 15Outdoor Education Centre.
page.content: In the 1960's a small piece of land was rented at Stanley Head Farm on which local schools camped.They also sailed and canoed on nearby Stanley Pool.In 1967,the City of Stoke-on-Trent purchased the farm for 25,000 pounds and developed it as an Outdoor Education Centre.It now belongs to the county of Staffordshire and it is used by over two hundred schools annually. The old farm buildings have been turned into a dormitory,dining room,kitchen and recreational accommodation.Schools may attend on a daily or a weekly residential basis.Secondary school pupils do map reading,orienteering,rock climbing,caving,sailing and canoeing. Younger children study animal and plant life around the centre,go pond dipping and attempt some basic orienteering. Sometimes they leave the centre to make a study of the surrounding villages.
